dict.string: BibTeX Citation Picker for Pandoc Citation Syntax

export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
citekey="{query}" bibfile=~`echo -n $bibtex_library_path | sed -e "s/~//"` csl=~`echo -n $csl_file | sed -e "s/~//"` dummyBib="---
nocite: |
 "$citekey"
---
::: {#refs}
:::"
echo -n $dummyBib | pandoc --citeproc --read=markdown --write=plain --csl $csl --bibliography $bibfile | tr "
" " "
No DOI found in first 4 pages.

[{"title":"✍️ Search & Download Citation Style","arg":"csl","subtitle":""},{"title":"💬 Change Citation Format","arg":"change_format","subtitle":""},{"title":"🔁 Buffer Reload","arg":"buffer_reload","subtitle":""},{"title":"❓Cheatsheet","arg":"cheatsheet","subtitle":""}]

CSL_DIR=~/.pandoc/csl/
mkdir -p "$CSL_DIR" cd "$CSL_DIR"
curl -sO "$*"
# for notification echo "$*"
This cannot be undone. [↵]: Confirm [Esc]: Cancel

export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
citekey="{query}" bibfile=~`echo -n $bibtex_library_path | sed -e "s/~//"` csl=~`echo -n $csl_file | sed -e "s/~//"` dummyBib="---
nocite: |
 "$citekey"
---
::: {#refs}
:::"
echo -n $dummyBib | pandoc --citeproc --read=markdown --write=plain --csl $csl --bibliography $bibfile | tr "
" " "

[{"title":"Pandoc","arg":"pandoc","subtitle":"[@citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Org Mode","arg":"org","subtitle":"[cite:@citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Multi-Markdown (MMD)","arg":"multi-markdown","subtitle":"[42][#citekey]"},{"title":"Latex","arg":"latex","subtitle":"\\cite{citekey} ℹ️ page numbers not supported"},{"title":"Wikilink","arg":"wikilink","subtitle":"[[citekey]] ℹ️ page number will become alias"},{"title":"Eta template","arg":"eta","subtitle":"{% cite citekey %}"},{"title":"iA Writer","arg":"iA Writer","subtitle":"[^citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Tag","arg":"tag","subtitle":"#citekey"},{"title":"Bare Citekey","arg":"bare citekey","subtitle":"citekey"},{"title":"Bracketed Citekey","arg":"bare citekey","subtitle":"(citekey)"},{"title":"Custom","arg":"custom","subtitle":"🌐 Open Browser with information on customatization"}]

## Alfred Gallery
[This workflow is now included in the Alfred gallery](http://alfred.app/workflows/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker/) and auto-updates will there be managed by Alfred and not by this workflow anymore.
---
# Supercharged Citation Picker - [README](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker#supercharged-citation-picker) - [Changelog](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker/blob/main/Changelog.md) - [Bug Reports](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker/issues)
## Workflow Setup 1. Add the path to your `.bib` to the right and you are good to go. 2. For all the features this workflow has to offer, refer to the [README](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker#supercharged-citation-picker). 3. The default citation style is *Pandoc Citations*. To switch it to LaTeX, Multi-Markdown, Org Mode, eta, [[wikilinks]], #tags, or bare citkeys use the keyword `scp` in Alfred and select `Change Citation Format`.
## Created by [Chris Grieser](https://chris-grieser.de/)
**Profiles** - [ResearchGate](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Christopher-Grieser) - [Discord](https://discordapp.com/users/462774483044794368/) - [GitHub](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/pseudo_meta) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-grieser-ba693b17a/)
**Buy me a Coffee** [Ko-Fi](https://ko-fi.com/pseudometa)
enclose page numbers in brackets & add citation

DOUBLE CLICK THIS
to set a hotkey for the citation picker

DOUBLE CLICK THIS
to set a hotkey for adding DOI/ISBN
Keyword for the Citation Picker. Alternatively, the Citation Picker can also be triggered via hotkey.
Folder containing your PDFs. Only required for indicating PDFs via icons, opening them via `Hyper↵`, or auto-filing PDFs via with `fn↵`.
Folder containing your literature notes (as markdown files). Only required for indicating literature notes via icon, and for creating/opening literature notes with `⌥⌃↵`.
Folder where downloaded citation styles will be saved. Only required for downloading citation styles via `scp` → `Citation Styles` or via `csl`.

App to open entries in when using `⇧↵`. Reference Managers will reveal the entry, while Text Editors will open the .bib file at the line containing the entry. ("default app" does not support opening at a specific line.)
Given the year "1990", short years will only match "90".
Whether the citation picker should match authors names that are in the et al. (If you have papers with hundreds of co-authors, you can disable this to improve matching.)
Copy the Pandoc citation to the clipboard.
